Degree understand your concerns went through your details. I suggest you not to worry much. OCD is not a psychotic disorder. OCD is a type of anxiety disorder. OCD is characterized by obsessions and compulsions. Obsessions are repeated thoughts, ideas, images, or impulses that are intrusive and unwanted and cause marked anxiety or distress. Compulsions are repetitive behaviors (e.g., washing hands, counting, putting things in order, etc.) or mental acts (e.g., praying, mental images, etc.) that the person feels driven to perform in response to an obsession. Psychotic disorders are characterized by hallucinations and delusions. You are having hallucinations and delusions. You are not having obsessions and compulsions. Therefore, you are not having OCD.
